definition: perfectly all right/without rhyme or reason
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
end/extremity/item/port/to hold sth level with both hands/to carry/regular
end/extremity/item/port/to hold sth level with both hands/to carry/regular

sentences.english: And yet, the world remains. Nothing is destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 可是，这个世界依旧好端端的，什么也没有被毁灭。

sentences.english: My baggage will get there all right, won"t it?"
sentences.chinese: 我的行李会好端端地到那边吧？

sentences.english: Yesterday is good a person, how to say no?
sentences.chinese: 昨日还好端端的一个人，怎么说没就没了呢？

sentences.english: Hey ye rotten mold of garlic tablets?
sentences.chinese: 好端端的大蒜粒咋烂掉霉变了？

definition: variant of 莫名其妙[mo4 ming2 qi2 miao4]
no cause, no reason (idiom); completely uncalled for
erhua variant of 納悶|纳闷[na4 men4]
to cause or lead to sth bad
unable to understand/unable to get over
variant of 平白無故|平白无故[ping2 bai2 wu2 gu4]
